title: Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475) Page Content ​​This visa is subject to the Cap and Cease arrangement that took effect on 22 September 2015. Any visa application that was not decided before 22 September 2015 will be taken not to have been made. You can use the visa finder to search for an appropriate visa If you already have this visa, your eligible family members can apply for the Skilled - Regional (Provisional) (subclass 489) visa Visa holders Details How long your visa lasts Details This visa is valid for three years from: the date the visa is granted, if you applied for the visa in Australia the date you enter Australia, if you applied for the visa outside Australia. What this visa lets you do Details This visa lets you: remain in Australia for up to three years in a specified regional area in Australia bring your family with you to work or study in in a specified regional area of Australia become eligible to apply for permanent residency Apply for permanent residency You might be able to apply for permanent residency after you have: lived in a specified regional area of Australia for two years worked for at least 12 months in a specified regional area of Australia. The Skilled – Regional visa (subclass 887) is specifically designed for holders of a provisional skilled visa who want to apply for permanent residency. Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. If you were nominated for this visa by a state or territory government Details You must live, study and work in regional Australia or a low population growth metropolitan area and comply with any residential conditions specified by the state or territory government in your nomination. If you later apply for a permanent residence Skilled – Regional visa (subclass 887) , you will need to prove that you have spent the specified time in that area. If you were sponsored for this visa by a family member Details You must live, study and work in a designated area. If you plan to apply for permanent residence, you will need to prove that you have spent the specified time in that area. Meeting these conditions Details If you do not comply with the conditions of your visa, your visa, and your family’s visa, may be cancelled. If your visa is cancelled, you will not be able to apply for a similar visa while you stay in Australia. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane. Sponsors Details This information is for the sponsor of a Skilled -​ Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475) holder. This visa is closed to new applications. This visa was subject to the cap and cease arrangement that took place on 22 September 2015. Visa applications that were not decided by 22 September 2015 are taken not to have been made. For more information on the cap and cease see: Cap and cease ​. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations) to check the visa status and entitlements of people you have sponsored. How long the sponsorship lasts Details Your sponsorship lasts for two years from the time the visa holder first enters Australia. Sponsor obligations Details For two years from the date the visa is granted, you have agreed to: provide adequate accommodation and financial assistance to meet your relative's living needs provide other support, such as child care, to help your relatives attend English language classes give information and​ advice (including information about employment in Australia) to help your relatives settle in Australia.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475)

Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475)
Page Content

​​This visa is subject to the Cap and Cease arrangement that took effect on 22 September 2015.  Any visa application that was not decided before 22 September 2015 will be taken not to have been made.

​​This visa is subject to the Cap and Cease arrangement that took effect on 22 September 2015.  Any visa application that was not decided before 22 September 2015 will be taken not to have been made.

You can use thevisa finderto search for an appropriate visa

You can use the
visa finder
to search for an appropriate visa

If you already have this visa, your eligible family members can apply for theSkilled - Regional (Provisional) (subclass 489) visa.

If you already have this visa, your eligible family members can apply for the
Skilled - Regional (Provisional) (subclass 489) visa
.

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

This visa is valid for three years from:

This visa is valid for three years from:
- the date the visa is granted, if you applied for the visa in Australia
the date the visa is granted, if you applied for the visa in Australia
- the date you enter Australia, if you applied for the visa outside Australia.
the date you enter Australia, if you applied for the visa outside Australia.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This visa lets you:

This visa lets you:
- remain in Australia for up to three years in a specified regional area in Australia
remain in Australia for up to three years in a specified regional area in Australia
- bring your family with you to work or study in in a specified regional area of Australia
bring your family with you to work or study in in a specified regional area of Australia
- become eligible to apply forpermanent residency.
become eligible to apply for
permanent residency
.

#### Apply for permanent residency

Apply for permanent residency

You might be able to apply for permanent residency after you have:

You might be able to apply for permanent residency after you have:
- lived in a specified regional area of Australia for two years
lived in a specified regional area of Australia for two years
- worked for at least 12 months in a specified regional area of Australia.
worked for at least 12 months in a specified regional area of Australia.

TheSkilled – Regional visa (subclass 887)is specifically designed for holders of a provisional skilled visa who want to apply for permanent residency.

The
Skilled – Regional visa (subclass 887)
is specifically designed for holders of a provisional skilled visa who want to apply for permanent residency.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

#### If you were nominated for this visa by a state or territory government

If you were nominated for this visa by a state or territory government
Details

You must live, study and work inregional Australia or a low population growth metropolitan areaand comply with any residential conditions specified by the state or territory government in your nomination.

You must live, study and work in
regional Australia or a low population growth metropolitan area
and comply with any residential conditions specified by the state or territory government in your nomination.

If you later apply for a permanent residenceSkilled – Regional visa (subclass 887), you will need to prove that you have spent the specified time in that area.

If you later apply for a permanent residence
Skilled – Regional visa (subclass 887)
, you will need to prove that you have spent the specified time in that area.

#### If you were sponsored for this visa by a family member

If you were sponsored for this visa by a family member
Details

You must live, study and work in a designated area. If you plan to apply for permanent residence, you will need to prove that you have spent the specified time in that area.

You must live, study and work in a designated area. If you plan to apply for permanent residence, you will need to prove that you have spent the specified time in that area.

#### Meeting these conditions

Meeting these conditions
Details

If you do not comply with the conditions of your visa, your visa, and your family’s visa, may be cancelled.

If you do not comply with the conditions of your visa, your visa, and your family’s visa, may be cancelled.

If your visa is cancelled, you will not be able to apply for a similar visa while you stay in Australia.

If your visa is cancelled, you will not be able to apply for a similar visa while you stay in Australia.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

## Sponsors

Sponsors
Details

This information is for the sponsor of a Skilled -​ Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475) holder.

This information is for the sponsor of a Skilled -​ Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475) holder.

This visa is closed to new applications. This visa was subject to the cap and cease arrangement that took place on 22 September 2015. Visa applications that were not decided by 22 September 2015 are taken not to have been made. For more information on the cap and cease see:Cap and cease​.

This visa is closed to new applications. This visa was subject to the cap and cease arrangement that took place on 22 September 2015. Visa applications that were not decided by 22 September 2015 are taken not to have been made. For more information on the cap and cease see:
Cap and cease
​.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)to check the visa status and entitlements of people you have sponsored.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)
to check the visa status and entitlements of people you have sponsored.

### How long the sponsorship lasts

How long the sponsorship lasts
Details

Your sponsorship lasts for two years from the time the visa holder first enters Australia.

Your sponsorship lasts for two years from the time the visa holder first enters Australia.

### Sponsor obligations

Sponsor obligations
Details

For two years from the date the visa is granted, you have agreed to:

For two years from the date the visa is granted, you have agreed to:
- provide adequate accommodation and financial assistance to meet your relative's living needs
provide adequate accommodation and financial assistance to meet your relative's living needs
- provide other support, such as child care, to help your relatives attend English language classes
provide other support, such as child care, to help your relatives attend English language classes
- give information and​ advice (including information about employment in Australia) to help your relatives settle in Australia.
give information and​ advice (including information about employment in Australia) to help your relatives settle in Australia.
